A culmination of about 11 years of Marvel Cinematic Universe and 22 movies, Avengers: Endgame isn’t just a film but an emotion that will stay with the fans forever. The fact that the movie broke several records even before the release, set the box office on fire after release, and the frenzy went onto another level that it became a little tough for cinema halls to handle it, is a proof enough what Avengers and its superheros mean for its fans.
Also Read: What’s Next After Avengers: Endgame? Here Are 7 Upcoming Marvel Movies To Watch Out For
AFP
Now that the Avengers are no more, Marvel fans all over the world are wondering as to what they will do. And some by their actions are proving that how much they, one Avenger in particular, means to them.
hellogiggles.com
A group of students, who call themselves hackers, from Institute of Technology (MIT) in Massachusetts transformed the university’s Great Dome into Captain America’s shield.
Also Read: 9 Instances That Prove The Frenzy For ‘Avengers: Endgame’ Was Too Much For Cinemas To Handle!
“Putting things on the dome is a big challenge. We hope people look at it and it gets their imagination going,” said a member of the group. Due to the secretive nature of the ‘pranks’, they don’t want to be named. But this, they say is a symbol of gratitude. Just to clarify, this, they have been planning for year when they got to know about the film’s release.

Chris Evans is all impressed!
Interestingly, Captain America has a connection with the town, as he is also a native of Sudbury, Massachusetts. If you know about any other crazy fan story from any part of the world, let us know about it in the comments section below.
